item.title: Life Update: Scholarship Paperwork, 3D Art & Getting Ready for Ramadan
item.description:
Intro

This week, I know exactly what I want to talk about… HEHEHEHE! 😆

The reason behind that? Well, I couldn’t do anything about AI Testing as planned.

But no worries! Life doesn’t always go as I want, so I just had to go with the flow. Meow 🐱

Here’s Why!

I had to finish the paperwork for a Korean Scholarship—it was a lot! Four sets of documents, to be exact.

Then, I helped prepare gifts for my lovely dad’s friends. He wanted to gift them dates and Zamzam water so they could break their fast during Ramadan, which starts on Sunday, March 2nd. I truly enjoyed the process of preparing these gifts. 🎁✨

On top of that, I started creating a 3D model based on one of my old 2D drawings! This is the first time I’m creating something from scratch without following a tutorial. It’s making me realize that I can do it—there’s no need to be afraid!

Of course, I still forget things like hotkeys, but thankfully, Blender’s guide and past tutorials are really helping me, especially with texturing and render settings.

Other than that…

Ramadan is starting tomorrow, and thanks to my mindful family, we’ve already agreed to keep things simple. No unnecessary stress, especially when it comes to food!

Our rule? Keep it minimal. Just two samosas each and soup is a must! 🍲

Conclusion

I promised myself that I’d post a blog every week, so here I am keeping that promise.

This was just a brief update about my week—so remember, just take it easy! 😊
